intro: Tithymalus rimarum, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. Tithymalus rimarum is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a rare species in many regions.
